headline: Best Turkey Burgers
description: This turkey burger recipe is quick to make with easy ingredients for tasty turkey burgers that are full of savory flavors your family will love.

video.description: This video demonstrates the best turkey burger recipe. We promise...these are really good - any cooking method may be used, and they freeze very well. The recipe can also be used for meatballs or meatloaf.
video.name: How to Make the Best Turkey Burgers

name: Best Turkey Burgers

recipeInstructions.text: Mix ground turkey, seasoned bread crumbs, onion, egg whites, parsley, garlic, salt, and pepper together in a large bowl.
Cook the patties in a medium skillet over medium heat, turning once, to an internal temperature of 180 degrees F (85 degrees C).

review.reviewBody: I grilled it and I grilled it a little too long cause I was prepping other things to go with it, so it was a little on the dry side, otherwise would have been great. I used only 1 lb of turkey, big handful of breadcrumbs, dash of soy sauce and worcestorshire, dried parsley and Uncle Chris' seasoning.
Best burger for a low-fat diet!
I used 1.3 lbs of meat and 1 egg And 1/4 onion & 1/4 bread crumb & 1tbls minced garlic and a drop of Visalia onion vinegarette marinade üëçüëç

These hamburgers are delicious! When I saw turkey burgers I was kinda skeptic to try the recipe because I thought the turkey meat is so lean they are going to be dry, but to my surprise, on the contrary, these hamburgers turned up juicy and delicious!

I loved these! They are moist and tasty. Made them pretty much as directed, but did add slightly more bread crumbs based on a "melting through the grill" comment. I also wasn't super religious about the exact amounts of onion, garlic and parsley, but venture to say I was pretty close. I had no problem with grilling them - they were terrific and the recipe goes into the "summertime" dinner rotation.

It was good. I baked them, added a mushroom sauce, butter, flour and a little chicken broth and sliced mushrooms. Other than that stuck to the recipie. Oh yea, my wife likes rosemary so I added that. Scaled out at 4-5 ounces per and made six on 1.2lbs of lean ground turkey.

followed Ausiemum1's advice with red peppers and seasoning and these burgers where so flavorful! Family had no clue that they were turkey burgers!!! served them with munster cheese, mustard, lettuce and tomato. So good!!!

Nice! Really tasty and easy to assemble. This has become my go-to whenever ground turkey is on sale. Note: Spreading horseradish mustard on the bun gives it a nice kick; the flavor goes well with the patty.
It was great. I can get used to this recipe
These are good enough to skip the beef.
Made this as is except used two whole eggs (didn't want to have to save yolks), and WOW! DELICIOUS!

I made 4 burgers with one LB ground turkey. I used one whole egg and added a bit of chopped green pepper plus cayenne pepper powder and a teaspoon olive oil. I eyeballed the other ingredients in the recipe. I will make a larger batch and freeze some next time. I served the burgers with tzatziki sauce, sliced cucumbers, tomatoes, and arugula.

The best turkey burger I've ever tasted!!!!! After reading through the reviews of this recipe I followed some of the suggested modifications. 2 tablespoons of soy sauce rather than salt and 1 teaspoon of worcesterchire sauce. I also used 2 cloves of garlic rather than 1 (because I love garlic). Everything else was exactly according to the recipe. I served these on slightly toasted cracked wheat buns with white cheddar cheese, grilled onions, tomato slices, lettuce, and the usual condiments. So delicious!!!

I tried this recipe because her husband preferred it to Beef Burgers. Truthfully, I didn't expect my husband to be thrilled but it sounded good. WELL...wonder of wonders, my husband said "These are really REALLY good and I think I prefer these to the regular hamburger patties you make!" I am dumbfounded! I loved the recipe for me and made extra patties for the freezer, but when Steve said that I KNEW this recipe is a keeper. I highly recommend it for flavor, ease of preparation and the fact that "picky" people will love it too. Thanks so much for sharing this!

Really good! For the small household: 
 used 1/2 # ground turkey, and about 1/4 of the rest of the ingredients instead of 1/6. Onion was two slices med onion and garlic 1/2 large clove, both finely minced. Finely snipped parsley until it looked like about right, like 1 Tbsp. 1 Tbsp plain breadcrumbs, 1 egg white beaten until frothy then about half roughly 2 Tbsp. 1/4 tsp salt and freshly ground black pepper until it looked right. IT TURNED OUT GREAT! Topped with a provalone slice while hot then between bun with mustard, raw onion rings and lettuce. YUM

I have never left a review for recipes I looked up online before this but, I had to pay my respects because my family absolutely loved these burgers!! I am on a health kick right now so fast food has been limited heavily and my entire family is trying to eat right as well. 

Ive been craving a McDonald‚Äôs Big Mac so, I used your recipe but, made the patties super thin to crispy them up a bit. Topped them with homemade thousand island and bam I‚Äôm a winner!

We agree. These burgers are actually delicious. I was surprised and disappointed to discover that I was out of breadcrumbs as I was preparing this dish. I had some wheat germ so I used that because I thought the consistency would be close. It worked, but next time I‚Äôll make sure to have breadcrumbs in the pantry. Served with bacon, cheese, avocado, and Sir Kensington‚Äôs Garlic Everything sauce. Delicious!

This was ABSOLUTELY delicious! The first time I made it, I used dried parsley, as I didn't have any fresh parsley on hand. STILL delicious! The second time, I used fresh parsley, but less than the recipe called for. I didn't want to overwhelm the burgers. *And one cool feature I have always loved about Allrecipes. com, you can tweak it by using the "adjustment" feature. My family only needs 4 burgers, so I put four in the adjustment, and it calculates how much of each ingredient I'll need. - Z. Mitchell, North Carolina.
I used a whole egg and added diced red pepper, Worcestershire sauce & a splash of soy sauce.
Delicious and moist!

I followed Aussiemum1's advice and these turned out amazing! The thing on turkey meat is that it has no flavor on its own but will take any flavor you give it. I thin cut a lot of green onion, Worstechire, seasoning salt and cayenne into mine. Coating them with flour was a great idea. Makes them easy to handle and no sticking to grill.
Thanks for the recipe!
Super easy and tasty! I leave the bun off and eat it as a turkey patty. It's yummy with some herbed mayo!
I followed the suggestions in some posts and it turned out great.
Okay, I‚Äôm giving this a 5 because it really was awesome.
Delicious! Used cilantro instead of parsley, and panko crumbs.

Great go to recipe added Worcestershire sauce as stated in another review. The best idea from someone else was to place in Pam sprayed cold George Forman Grill, then plug in for 15 minutes, came out perfectly cooked! Served on potato bun with melted cheese, lettuce ketchup & Mayo, delicious!
Very impressed. We "adjusted" the size to 4. Read the reviews and "winged it".
I thought I was delicious but I also added another seasoning to it which added a sweet, tangy and spicy flavor and O.M.G! Talk out awesome flavors just rolling around in your mouth
I add some Worcestershire sauce but other than that we loved them! Ours cooked fine on a BBQ. Will make again!

These burgers are actually delicious! I scaled down for 4 servings since I only had 1# ground turkey. I also used some season salt, about 1 teaspoon or so.Thanks for a healthier version of a favorite burger. Even my meat loving son liked them!

I made this for my family. It was a hit for everyone, even my picky young adult meat eaters. They are now Turkey burger fans and I didn‚Äôt even add the parsley for fear of their rejection but I will add it next time. Great recipe!
I added a little more onion and garlic because I love them but these burgers were AMAZING. Really impressed, definitely try this one out.
Meh at best.

I had to adjust the recipe for 2 people. I used 1 lb of ground turkey, 4 TBSP of gluten free bread crumbs, and a whole egg along with lots of red onion and seasoning. I read a comment about dusting both sides of the patty with flour to help hold it together. I tired this technique and it worked great. I cooked the burgers on my grill whitout any problem. I will use this recipe again and continue to try different seasoning.
Really easy and super delicious! Wouldn't change a thing!
Super light and flavorful! I followed most of the recipe except I double the breadcrumbs and everyone loved it!
I made this and it was amazing! I made mine into 8 patties. I used 4 baby bell Gouda cheeses sliced in half to stuff my patties. It was divine!
The recipe is fine as-is and makes for the perfect base for variety. I use 1 full egg per pound, cornmeal rather than bread crumbs and a Mexican seasoning to give it some punch.

I had 1lb of ground turkey so I adjusted the recipe to 1/3. I ended up with 4 good sized burgers.
They were delicious!! I'll definitely make them again.
This recipe is easy and delicious!
This is my favorite turkey burger recipe!
Easy and delicious
This really is good. I've kept this recipe and use it often. My family who can eat anything and not gain weight, likes it too. That's saying a lot.

I used previously cooked finely chopped dark turkey meat left over from thanks giving instead of raw ground turkey. There is a huge difference how the meat clumps and cooks. Precooked meat will aggressively absorb any moisture from the eggs. You will need to flash cook the precooked meat at a higher temperature with more oil in the pan to prevent scorching. Just play it by ear and you will get an idea how much oil and how hot to push it.
I have made it 3 times now. All of my family members love it! I agree, it is better than beef burger
It was good, though ground turkey is not really tasty it tends to be dry, no matter what. The recipe was good.

Not bad! It was a little bit of a challenge to make sure they hit the right temperature in the pan, but the rest of the process wasn't difficult. It was a quick recipe and I thought the taste of them were pretty good. They taste a lot better and have more flavor than the turkey burgers you get from the freezer section of the grocery store, so I plan to make these again. I'll be tweaking the recipe a little more.

Using 1lb Turkey, for 4 patties, aded 1/4 cup bread crumbs, 1 whole egg, 1/4 cup minced onion and mushroom. Butter on nonstick pan. Medium/low heat.
 Takes longer but reduced sticking chance, to pan turkey patties seemed to take longer to cook evenly anyway.
Actually Delicous Turkey Burgers byTrudi Davidoff. 1 1/2# mixed turkey; 1/4c plain breadcrumbs; 1/4t liquid smoke, salt, onion powder, garlic powder; 2T worcestershire; 1/2t fresh black

Thank you for this recipe. I have only 1 kidney so i eat low sodium and no red meat in my diet. These are delicious and need nothing extra, as adding worchestire sauce etc adds sault people dont need. I used turkey n chicken and mixed up a batch for the freezer.

Very nice recipe. I only made this for two, so the portions of things were adjusted wildly. I used a whole egg (I will try to use less next time) and a bit more bread crumbs than suggested (1/2 italian seasoned bread crumbs, 1/2 panko), 2 garlic cloves, grated shallot instead of onion, 1/2 tsp. umami mushroom spice and 1/2 tsp. 21 seasoning blend (both Trader Joes), a glugg of soy sauce and worcestershire sauce, 3/4 tsp. seasoning salt instead of regular salt, probably double parsely. I cooked on med-high for 5-6 min, per side. The burgers were very good, but could have taken even more seasoning,
Wonderful. Will definitely make again.
DELICIOUS! Added more garlic and bell pepper. Dynamite.
This recipe is the best. I like the simple flavor of the turkey and sometimes alternate the taste by using a variety of cheeses.

This was a delicious recipe. Turkey burgers often tend to be dry, and these weren't at all. I was worried that the mixture was too gummy as it was difficult to mold into burger patties, but I formed each patty on its own piece of parchment paper which made it easy just to flip the paper over to put them on the grill. They turned out perfectly - moist and held their shape. I did add a bit of Worcestershire sauce to mine, too.

when I make turkey burgers i do pretty much the same ingredients except i add A-1 or worstershire sauce, i use two teaspoons per pound, my wife does care for the turkey smell of ground turkey when cooking & this helps with smell & gives it a little more beef flavor
Made exactly as stated. Came out "delicious." Very easy to put together as well. Used Forman Grill.
I read several reviews and made a few additions, including liquid smoke, soy sauce, Worcestershire sauce and bell pepper. These were very good and will be the recipe we use for turkey burgers.
Super delicious!
Super easy! Made these in my air fryer and they came out delicious!

My daughter and I made this for dinner one evening a few weeks ago. It was hit! My husband and oldest daughter weren‚Äôt really into trying it, but once they did, they loved it!! We are having them again tomorrow night.
I even made this to venison and my husband loved it!

First I made this recipe exactly as written. I found it lacking in flavor for my taste but a great foundation recipe. Here's how I adjusted it to add a lot more flavor. I used sauteed caramelized onion in the mixture instead of raw onion. I also added a tbs of caramelized garlic paste which I make myself. (recipe for the garlic paste below) I used Johnnies Seasoning instead of salt and pepper. I used 2 whole eggs instead of egg whites. The mixture was quite loose so I did not cook them on a grill as it would have made a mess on the grates. I sprayed just a wee bit of avocado oil on the burgers and cooked them in my basket style air fryer on 375 F for about 7 mins. After the patties cook for a few minutes they firm up quickly so they are easy to turn. These cook very quickly so don't over cook them. 
I made a dressing to go on toasted buns using mayo and marinated sun dried tomatoes mixed together about an hour before serving so the sun dried tomatoes hydrated. I also put sweet banana peppers on the burgers.
Super Juicy, great taste!!

Just like the name... these are ‚Äúactually delicious‚Äù! 
Hubby loved them and said ‚ÄúAdd this to the rotation!!!‚Äù
I typed the patties with crumbled bue cheese, blue cheese dressing, fresh tomato and thinly sliced onion. Served on a toasted bun.
They came out great!!!

Great turkey burger, with excellent flavor! We cooked the turkey burgers on an inside grill, and turned out beautifully. After reading other reviews, adding Worcestershire sauce definitely enhances flavor, as well as coating the burgers in light flour to help hold together when cooking. Seasoning paired perfectly together and will be making this in the future.
I only used 2 lbs of turkey but followed everything else.
Moist and delicious, even in a grill pan on the stovetop. Added a splash of worcestershire sauce.
Delicious! I did not alter recipe and grilled on the BGE. Used Pecan chips for a touch of smoke. Every bit as good as any beef burger if not better. A wonderful change of taste for the palate.
I added cilantro mint Garamond masala and lemon juice in the ground turkey Before making the patties. Came out so good. Delicious
I enjoyed it and my family enjoyed it too. Very easy to make. Very juicy. I will make again for sure.

Yum - these were delicious. I made some of the suggested adjustments: used 1 whole egg instead of just the whites, increased breadcrumbs, added seasoned salt, Worcestershire and soy sauce. We pan-fried the burgers for several minutes per side, not touching them between turns to get the crispy outer crust.
delicious!!! i made it 2 times already!!!! i added a splash of teriyaki and some chives, a whole egg , and cooked the onion with some red bell pepper before put it on the mix.It is a keeper!!!
I added two garlic clovers and a little more pepper but it came out great!

Cut recipe in half, since there are only two of us to eat these up. Enjoyed them very much. I also used Rachel Ray's Technique of making a small-medium indentation in the center of the burger. Once in the grill (or in the fry pan) the center will Puff Up! With that indentation your burger should be fairly even and not Overly Plump!
I added more bread crumbs and used my ‚Äúgreen spice‚Äù seasoning: premade parsely, celery, ginger, garlic & onions blended and frozen in little packs convenient as seasoning.
They were delicious!

Made exactly as written. They were actually delicious. I ate it with a fresh tomato and sweet pickles on top. No bun. A side of coleslaw to go with it. 
Maybe next time, I will add a splash of worshteshire sauce.
Super simple to make and as delicious as the recipe name states.
Very tasty burgers!!!

It was delicious followed some of the suggestions added more bread crumbs and only used 1 extra large egg. My family really enjoyed them. I baked the 2nd batch. The first batch kept sticking to the skillet no matter how much oil I used. 

Definitely a winner!
This is a favorite but I also add, smoked paprika in the recipe and on sprinkle a little on the outside when cooking. Taste like it‚Äôs been on the grill!!

Quite literally the best turkey burgers I've had. Moist and tasty. I made a smaller batch (1 lb turkey, 1 egg white) which yielded 6 fairly large patties. I'm gluten free so I used toasted GF bread for the crumbs. To avoid GERD, I eliminated the onion. To replace some flavor, I added garlic powder and smoked paprika.
Burgers were great! I added a finely chopped shallots and topped with saut√©ed peppers and onions!
Burgers were great! I added a finely chopped shallots and topped with saut√©ed peppers and onions!
Quick and easy. Burgers turned out great and we‚Äôre not dry at all. I didn‚Äôt do any additions or subtractions, but next time I may play with some additional ingredients.
Best turkey burgers I've ever had!

Beyond terrible. May have been the texture of the ground Turkey (Butterball brand) but the overall texture of this dish was disgusting and the garlic flavor was simply too dominant. I ended up throwing the entire concoction away
Excellent! Very juicy!

I couldn't face another summer of frozen, mass produced turkey burgers again so I decided to make some from scratch. This is a great recipe and they do actually taste good! I did t use the bread crumbs because I'm trying to cut down on carbs. They came out great!
Absolutely delicious. I pan fried them with olive oil and topped the burgers with Worcestershire sauce and sliced tomatoes. The best turkey burger recipe I've ever had.

This is a genius recipe. Up until this recipe, I have made the "actually worse turkey burgers". 

This one has simple ingredients and elegant taste. I had one pound of turkey so I used the Allrecipes' adjustment. And, you can grill. Of course, the grill needs to be very hot and the burgers should be brushed with oil (I used olive oil). 

I had to use celery tops (chopped finely) because I didn't have parsley. But all other ingredients were used and I didn't add or replace anything else. 

Thank you for sharing this wonderful recipe!!!!

Oh ...forgot to say I used 93% lean/7% fat ground turkey.
This recipe was easy to make and by far the best home made turkey burger I have had! My family absolutely loved it!! Flavorful and moist. Thanks for sharing this!
That weren‚Äôt bad need to add more spices.
Great recipe, only thing I changed was instead of bread crumbs I used blended oats and a little Garlic Plus seasoning. Also made on the George Forman.
I substituted parmesan cheese for the bread crumbs and added oregano, basil, rosemary and thyme for the seasonings! These are delicious!
So good!! They came out delicious and juicy. I made mine on the grill and they were amazing! I added some Worcestershire sauce to it and a little bit of diced jalape√±os to give it a little kick
